body_html:
For posterity I'd like to add my successful build specs:

I followed this tutorial but used the following versions. I also MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py clean after every failed build.

macOS 10.13.4
XCode 9.3
CUDA 9.1 Toolkit
cuDNN 6.0
CLT for 8.3.2 (18 April 2017) + sudo xcode-select --switch /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools

Sadly the console of an app I was testing told me

Found GPU0 GeForce GT 750M which is of cuda capability 3.0. 
PyTorch no longer supports this GPU because it is too old.

body:
For posterity I'd like to add my successful build specs:

I followed [this tutorial](https://zhaoyu.li/post/install-pytorch-on-mac-with-nvidia-gpu/) but used the following versions. I also `MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py clean` after every failed build.

macOS 10.13.4
XCode 9.3
[CUDA 9.1 Toolkit](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads?target_os=MacOSX&target_arch=x86_64&target_version=1013)
[cuDNN 6.0](https://anaconda.org/anaconda/cudnn)
[CLT for 8.3.2 (18 April 2017)](https://developer.apple.com/download/more/) + `sudo xcode-select --switch /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools`

Sadly the console of an app I was testing told me 
```
Found GPU0 GeForce GT 750M which is of cuda capability 3.0. 
PyTorch no longer supports this GPU because it is too old.
```
